Package ca.mcgill.ecse211.project

Class Mapping

  • java.lang.Object
    • ca.mcgill.ecse211.project.Mapping
  • public class Mapping
extends java.lang.Object
    The Mapping class converts raw map data to coordinates that are used by the robot after initial localization. As the robot will localize in different directions based on its starting zone, its internal x and y-axis will be different with respect to the given raw map coordinates so these coordinates must be converted to a form that respects the internal localizer x and y-axis.

      • mapOdo

        public void mapOdo​(int corner)

      • getBridgeOrient

        public char getBridgeOrient​(int TN_LL_x,
                            int TN_UR_x)
        Finds which way the bridge is oriented with respect to the robot by taking the difference between the lower left and upper right x-coordinates of the bridge. As they are only 1 square apart, if the difference is 0, then the bridge must be oriented in the Y-direction, else, the x-direction.
        Parameters:
        TN_LL_x - : the lower left x-coordinate of the bridge.
        TN_UR_x - : the upper right x-coordinate of the bridge.
        Returns:
        "X" if oriented in the x-direction, "Y" if oriented in the y-direction.

      • getBridgeExit

        public double[] getBridgeExit​(int TN_LL_x,
                              int TN_LL_y,
                              int TN_UR_x,
                              int TN_UR_y)
        calculates the bridge exit coordinate from the corner coordinates of the bridge
        Parameters:
        TN_LL_x - : Lower left x-coordinate of the bridge
        TN_LL_y - : Lower left y-coordinate of the bridge
        TN_UR_x - : Upper right x-coordinate of the bridge
        TN_UR_y - : Upper right y-coordinate of the bridge
        Returns:
        The (x,y) coordinate of the bridge exit
